intro: Matthiola odoratissima var. taurica, commonly known as the Taurian stock, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the Tauric Chersonese, a region in the Black Sea area, and is characterized by its fragrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, typical of the Brassicaceae family. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in perfumery and traditional medicine.
